frame.name: Containers
frame.definition: <def-root>This frame covers entities which are prototypically conceived of and created to fulfill the function of containing--i.e. <fen>Container</fen>s that contain objects or substances, the <fen>Contents</fen>. This can be expressed as a complement , and includes potential or intended contents. A <fen>Container</fen> may also have an <fen>Owner</fen>, a current <fen>Relative_location</fen>, <fen>Material</fen> from which it is constructed, a method of <fen>Construction</fen>, and a <fen>Type</fen>. Note the connection between words in this frame and those in the Filling, Emptying, and Fullness frames. <ex>a <fex name="Container"><t>bag</t></fex> <fex name="Contents">of popcorn</fex></ex> <ex><fex name="Contents">underwear</fex> <fex name="Container"><t>drawer</t></fex></ex> <ex><fex name="Owner">Chuck's</fex> <fex name="Container"><t>suitcase</t></fex></ex> <ex><fex name="Container">the <t>suitcase</t></fex> <fex name="Rel_loc">in Chuck's office</fex></ex> <ex><fex name="Mat">straw</fex> <fex name="Container"><t>basket</t></fex></ex> <ex><fex name="Cons">woven</fex> <fex name="Container"><t>basket</t></fex></ex> <ex><fex name="Type">Erlenmeyer</fex> <fex name="Container"><t>flask</t></fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Container
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Container</fen> is an object which is conventionally used as a container. Target words in this frame are tagged with this frame element.
<ex>John carried a <fex name="Container"><t>bucket</t></fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Contents
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Contents</fen> is the object(s)/stuff contained in the <fen>Container</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Material</fen> identifies the material of which the <fen>Container</fen> is made.
<ex><fex name="Mat">straw</fex> <fex name="Container"><t>basket</t></fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Type
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Type</fen> designates the type of <fen>Container</fen>. Often the <fen>Type</fen> labels part of a multi-word or compound word target.
<ex><fex name="Type">Erlenmeyer</fex> <fex name="Container"><t>flask</t></fex></ex> <ex><fex name="Type">TABLE</fex><fex name="Container">SPOON</fex></ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Relative_location
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Relative_location</fen> is the location of the <fen>Container</fen>.
<ex>The <fex name="Container"><t>wallet</t></fex> <fex name="Rel_loc">in his pocket</fex> was full of photos of his family.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Construction
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Construction</fen> indicates the action (or causer) which creates the Container.
<ex><fex name="Cons">fired</fex> <fex name="Container"><t>urns</t></fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Owner
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Owner</fen> identifies the owner of the <fen>Container</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Owner">Chuck's</fex> <fex name="Container"><t>suitcase</t></fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Use
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Use</fen> identifies the purpose for which an artifact is constructed and the activity with which it is associated, or the <fen>Contents</fen> protypically contained in the <fen>Container</fen>. <ex><fex name="Use">watering</fex> <fex name="Container"><t>can</t></fex></ex> <ex><fex name="Use">wine</fex> <fex name="Container"> <t>glass</t></fex></ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Part
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies a <fen>Part</fen> of the <fen>Container</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Part">screw top</fex> <fex name="Container"><t>bottle</t></fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Descriptor</fen> describes some aspect of the <fen>Container</fen>.
<ex>He put everything into a <fex name="Descriptor">really really huge</fex> <t>briefcase</t></ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: amphora.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a tall ancient Greek or Roman jar or jug with two handles and a narrow neck

lexUnit.name: backpack.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a rucksack.

lexUnit.name: can.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a cylindrical metal container, in particular one in which food or drink is hermetically sealed for storage over long periods.

lexUnit.name: capsule.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small case or container

lexUnit.name: cart.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a shallow open container on wheels, pulled or pushed by hand.

lexUnit.name: casket.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a (decorated) box or chest for holding valuable objects

lexUnit.name: chest.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large strong box for storage or transport.

lexUnit.name: envelope.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a flat paper container with a sealable flap, used to enclose a letter or document.

lexUnit.name: flask.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a narrow-necked conical or spherical bottle

lexUnit.name: glass.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a drinking container made of glass.

lexUnit.name: handbag.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (Brit.) a small bag used by a woman to carry everyday personal items.

lexUnit.name: jar.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a wide-mouthed cylindrical container made of glass or pottery

lexUnit.name: knapsack.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a soldier's or hiker's bag with shoulder straps, carried on the back.

lexUnit.name: ladle.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a large long-handled spoon with a cup-shaped bowl, used for transferring hot liquids

lexUnit.name: locker.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a small lockable cupboard or compartment, typically used for clothes and personal belongings

lexUnit.name: mug.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large cup, typically cylindrical and with a handle and used without a saucer

lexUnit.name: pot [cooking].n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a rounded or cylindrical container, especially one of ceramic, used for storage or cooking.

lexUnit.name: purse.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small pouch of leather or plastic used for carrying money or a handbag.

lexUnit.name: reservoir.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a receptacle for liquid

lexUnit.name: sack.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large bag made of a material such as hessian or thick paper, used for storing and carrying goods.

lexUnit.name: satchel.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a shoulder bag with a long strap, used especially for school books.

lexUnit.name: spoon.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an implement consisting of a small, shallow oval or round bowl on a long handle, used for eating, stirring, and serving food.

lexUnit.name: suitcase.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a case with a handle and a hinged lid, used for carrying clothes and other personal possessions.

lexUnit.name: tin.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a container made of tinplate or aluminium, typically used for baking or storing

lexUnit.name: wallet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a pocket-sized, flat, folding holder for money and plastic cards

lexUnit.name: teaspoon.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small spoon used for adding sugar to and stirring hot drinks or for eating some foods.

lexUnit.name: ampule.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a small capsule

lexUnit.name: ashtray.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: 1. a small receptacle for tobacco ash and cigarette ends.

lexUnit.name: bag.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a (flexible) container, which may have an open top, for carrying one's belongings

lexUnit.name: barrel.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a cylindrical container bulging out in the middle, traditionally made of wooden staves enclosed by metal hoops

lexUnit.name: basin.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large bowl or open container for washing in, preparing food, or holding liquid

lexUnit.name: basket.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a container used to hold or carry things, made from interwoven strips of cane or wire

lexUnit.name: beaker.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a cylindrical glass container used for drinking or in a laboratory

lexUnit.name: bin.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a storage receptacle, sometimes for depositing rubbish

lexUnit.name: bottle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a container with a narrow neck, used for storing liquids.

lexUnit.name: bowl.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a round, deep dish or basin

lexUnit.name: box.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a container with a flat base and sides and a lid

lexUnit.name: briefcase.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a flat rectangular case for carrying books and documents

lexUnit.name: bucket.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a cylindrical open container with a handle, used to carry liquids.

lexUnit.name: canister.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a round or cylindrical container used for storing food, chemicals, rolls of film, etc.

lexUnit.name: canteen.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small water bottle, as used by soldiers or campers

lexUnit.name: carafe.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an open-topped glass flask typically used for serving wine in a restaurant.

lexUnit.name: carton.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a light cardboard container

lexUnit.name: cartridge.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the containing/housing part of an object designed for insertion into a larger device, typically containing some resource used by the device; often used to refer to the entire inserted object.

lexUnit.name: case.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a container designed to hold or protect something

lexUnit.name: coffer.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small chest for holding valuables.

lexUnit.name: coffin.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long, narrow box in which a dead body is buried or cremated.

lexUnit.name: container.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an object for holding or transporting something

lexUnit.name: cooler.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a device or container for keeping things cool.

lexUnit.name: crate.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a slatted wooden case used for transporting goods

lexUnit.name: crock.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an earthenware pot or jar

lexUnit.name: crucible.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a container in which metals or other substances may be melted or subjected to very high temperatures

lexUnit.name: cruet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small container for salt, pepper, oil, or vinegar for use at a dining table

lexUnit.name: cup.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small bowl-shaped container for drinking from, typically having a handle and used with a matching saucer

lexUnit.name: cuspidor.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (N. Amer.) a spittoon.

lexUnit.name: cylinder.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a cylindrical container for liquefied gas under pressure

lexUnit.name: cask.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large barrel-like container for the storage of liquid, especially alcoholic drinks

lexUnit.name: carryall.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (N. Amer.) a large bag or case.

lexUnit.name: censer.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a container in which incense is burnt.

lexUnit.name: chalice.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a goblet

lexUnit.name: creamer.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (N. Amer.) a jug for cream.

lexUnit.name: decanter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a stoppered glass container into which wine or spirit is decanted

lexUnit.name: dish.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a shallow, typically flat-bottomed container for cooking or serving food

lexUnit.name: dispenser.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A device which stores a substance or (us. homogeneous) items, designed to release a measured amount for use.

lexUnit.name: drum.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a cylindrical object or part, especially a container:

lexUnit.name: duffel bag.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a cylindrical canvas bag

lexUnit.name: flagon.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large container for serving or consuming drinks

lexUnit.name: empty.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (informal) a bottle or glass left empty of its contents.

lexUnit.name: etui.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (dated) a small ornamental case for holding needles, cosmetics, and other articles.

lexUnit.name: goblet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a drinking glass with a foot and a stem

lexUnit.name: grail.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (in medieval legend) the cup or platter used by Christ at the Last Supper and in which Joseph of Arimathea received Christ's blood, especially as the object of quests by knights.

lexUnit.name: hamper.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (Brit.) a basket used for food

lexUnit.name: haversack.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small, stout bag carried on the back or over the shoulder, used especially by soldiers and walkers

lexUnit.name: hopper.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a container for grain, rock, or rubbish, typically one that tapers downward and discharges its contents at the bottom

lexUnit.name: jeroboam.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a wine bottle with a capacity four times larger than that of an ordinary bottle

lexUnit.name: jigger.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a small glass used for alcoholic drinks

lexUnit.name: jug.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a cylindrical container with a handle and a lip, for holding and pouring liquids

lexUnit.name: keg.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small barrel, especially one of less than 10 gallons or (in the US) 30 gallons

lexUnit.name: magnum.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a wine bottle of twice the standard size, normally 112 litres

lexUnit.name: mailer.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a container used for conveying items by post

lexUnit.name: overnighter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an overnight bag.

lexUnit.name: pack.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a small container or carton that goods are sold in

lexUnit.name: sarcophagus.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a stone coffin, typically associated with ancient Egypt, Rome, and Greece.

lexUnit.name: tun.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large beer or wine cask

lexUnit.name: stein.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large earthenware beer mug

lexUnit.name: spittoon.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a container for spitting into

lexUnit.name: pannier.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a large container carried on the back (of an animal).

lexUnit.name: ramekin.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small dish for baking and serving an individual portion of food.

lexUnit.name: reticule.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (chiefly historical) a woman's small handbag, typically having a drawstring and decorated with embroidery or beading. [Fashion]

lexUnit.name: salver.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a tray, typically one made of silver and used in formal circumstances.

lexUnit.name: samovar.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a highly decorated Russian tea urn

lexUnit.name: snifter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a balloon glass for brandy

lexUnit.name: thermos.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: (trademark) a vacuum flask.

lexUnit.name: tureen.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a deep covered dish from which soup is served

lexUnit.name: valise.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small travelling bag or suitcase

lexUnit.name: cauldron.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large metal pot, used for cooking over an open fire.

lexUnit.name: casserole.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large dish with a lid, used for cooking food slowly in an oven

lexUnit.name: folder.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a folding cover or wallet for storing loose papers.

lexUnit.name: rucksack.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: .a bag with two shoulder straps which allow it to be carried on the back, used by hikers.

lexUnit.name: pouch.n
lexUnit.definition: COD:.a small flexible bag.

lexUnit.name: vial.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small container used especially for holding liquid medicines.

lexUnit.name: vase.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a decorative container without handles, typically made of glass or china and used as an ornament or for displaying cut flowers.

lexUnit.name: pail.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a bucket.

lexUnit.name: pipette.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a slender tube with a bulb at one end, filled by sucking liquid into the tube, used for transferring or measuring out quantities of the liquid.

lexUnit.name: tumbler.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a drinking glass with straight sides and no handle or stem. formerly having a rounded bottom so as not to stand upright.

lexUnit.name: vat.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large tank or tub used to hold liquid

lexUnit.name: vivarium.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an enclosure or structure used for keeping animals under semi-natural conditions for observation or study or as pets; an aquarium or terrarium.

lexUnit.name: punch bowl.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a deep bowl for mixing and serving punch.

lexUnit.name: toilet bowl.n
lexUnit.definition: FN:

lexUnit.name: wine bottle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a glass bottle for wine, the standard size holding 75 cl or 2623 fl. oz.

lexUnit.name: chest of drawers.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a piece of furniture used for storage, consisting of an upright frame into which drawers are fitted

lexUnit.name: hot-water bottle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a flat, oblong rubber container that is filled with hot water and used for warming a bed or part of the body

lexUnit.name: urn.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a tall, rounded vase with a stem and base, especially one for storing a cremated person's ashes or a tall, rounded container with a tap (usually for storing coffee or tea).

lexUnit.name: tank.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large receptacle or storage chamber, especially for liquid or gas.

lexUnit.name: safe.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a strong fireproof cabinet with a complex lock, used for the storage of valuables.

lexUnit.name: planter.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: decorative container in which plants are grown

lexUnit.name: pot.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an open-topped container

lexUnit.name: drawer.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a lidless box-like storage compartment made to slide horizontally in and out of a desk or chest.

lexUnit.name: goldfish bowl.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: a bowl for pet goldfish, often partially spherical. Often used metaphorically for a situation in which others can see everything one does.

lexUnit.name: tub.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an open, flat-bottomed, usually round container
